coronasafe/leaderboard#171
activity.text:
First clone the leaderboard repo and delete the data and contributions folder 
![Screenshot_20231227-093842_GitHub.jpg](https://github.com/coronasafe/leaderboard/assets/98876115/aeb07bcc-cfa4-442d-aa81-a282b98bf87e)

Then download the leaderboard-data repo as zip 

![Screenshot_20231227-093805_GitHub.jpg](https://github.com/coronasafe/leaderboard/assets/98876115/b8666627-64b8-42f9-b489-12df8796ef8d)



And move the contributions and data folder from the leaderboard-Data to leaderboard folder 
![Screenshot_20231227-093815_GitHub.jpg](https://github.com/coronasafe/leaderboard/assets/98876115/30168167-5844-44b6-b7a3-24ba01d0c858)

activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#171
activity.text:
@sagarkori143 so basically go to leaderboard-data repo and then download the repo as zip 

Unzip the file and there u will find data and contributions folder 

Delete these folders in the leaderboard repo and then move the data and contributions folder from leaderboard-data to main repo 

Cc @rithviknishad 

Also I don't know of it's the recent data but the whole program works

- [x] Use the recent or the lastest log update for mews
- [ ] Add consciousness level to normal log update

So I was just finishing the last task
I will push the pr in a few hours

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6665
activity.text:
@rithviknishad  can you unassign me this issue as I am unable to find an optimal solution for the problem

The process is to refetch the current user query when the user logins correctly

My attempts to this were:

- Passed the refetch option as props, but it resulted in the code becoming quite messy.
- Used the current URL as a condition for refetch  but doing so caused many requests each time the url changes

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6765
activity.text: like this happens for all components when the loading screen is present or the data is small it suddenly changes the scroll position as the page height becomes small

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6760
activity.text:
> As per the issue, if I file a log update, and any fields required for MEWS are missing, it should specify why the MEWS data is unavailable

@nihal467 gigin mentioned that all five conditions must be present for mews update. But one of the conditions is consciousness which is only available in critical care so I made a condition where only if the recent log update is critical care then only the mews component is shown

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6495
activity.text:
>  The navigate should work, why is it navigating to `/` or going into the refresh loop?

![image](https://github.com/coronasafe/care_fe/assets/98876115/49b0eef7-e99c-4c66-923e-7f80274167f1)
![image](https://github.com/coronasafe/care_fe/assets/98876115/37f3c77f-22b6-4859-8689-c6d5bb23ea9b)

The issue arises from the `isAuthenticated` function continuing to return `true`, even when the token is incorrect. Furthermore, I can keep the browsing history intact until the session expiration page, but when I attempt to navigate to the login page, the entire history is wiped clean.

As a solution, I reached out to @rithviknishad , who suggested revisiting the query parameter approach. Now, the recommendation is to check if the origin of the redirect URL matches the origin of care.

@Ashesh3 , I'm currently implementing the query parameter approach.

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6495
activity.text:
> We could use the custom hook we have `useAppHistory` (which would inherently be prone from the attack mentioned before)

As we are doing `window.location.href="/session-expired"` we are losing all the history we have 
tried it with `navigate()` but that is directly changing the page URL to `/` or going on a refresh loop

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6495
activity.text: Maybe we can check if the `history` from `useAppHistory` matches the site domain and then redirect

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6495
activity.text:
now it adds a / in between of the .my.subdomian 
do you want me to sanitise the redirect further like remove any . or other symbols in front of the redirect?
